JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the Court by Mr F. Unterasinger , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Ambassador PERSON , Head of ORG at ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG filed an indictment against the applicant , accusing him of aiding and abetting embezzlement ( PERSON ) . ORG dismissed the applicant ’s objections against the indictment on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . The trial was scheduled by ORG ( PERSON ) from CARDINAL DATE to DATE . As he had suffered a heart attack DATE , the applicant was unable to attend the trial on DATE .
CARDINAL . Following CARDINAL expert opinions obtained on DATE and CARDINAL DATE attesting that he was temporarily unfit to stand trial , ORG decided to stay the proceedings against the applicant .

CARDINAL . As further expert opinions of CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE showed that the applicant would be able to attend the trial under certain conditions , ORG scheduled hearings for DATE and CARDINAL DATE . Referring to his state of health , the applicant refused to attend these hearings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered that the trial be held at GPE , where the applicant resided , on DATE and DATE . On DATE the applicant asked ORG to postpone the hearing because of his poor state of health . ORG granted the request for the further postponement , having examined the applicant ’s state of health .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL further expert opinions of DATE and DATE attested that the applicant had a limited ability to attend the trial , whereas a later opinions dated DATE raised concerns regarding the applicant ’s attendance at a lengthy trial .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again decided to stay the proceedings .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL expert reports obtained on DATE and DATE stated that the applicant ’s state of health had worsened and that , as it was unlikely to improve in the near future , he should not be exposed to major stress .
CARDINAL . On DATE and on DATE the applicant submitted to ORG , upon its request , certificates by CARDINAL specialist doctors treating him showing that he was still unfit to stand trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested that the criminal proceedings be terminated ( Einstellung des ORG ) because he considered that it was against the Convention to continue the proceedings in circumstances like his .

CARDINAL . ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request on DATE . It held that since the indictment was issued the grounds for suspicion had not changed or been dissipated and that the applicant ’s state of health alone did not constitute a reason to terminate the criminal proceedings against him .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s subsequent appeal against that decision . It found that it was only possible to terminate the proceedings against the applicant upon a request by ORG .
CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE , ORG again decided to stay the proceedings . An appeal against this decision was dismissed by ORG on DATE . The proceedings are still pending .

CARDINAL . It appears further that , in separate proceedings , on DATE ORG convicted the applicant of fraud ( PERSON ) , on DATE the ORG convicted him of having caused negligent bodily harm ( fahrlässige PERSON ) and on DATE the ORG convicted him of theft ( PERSON ) .
